@Lucy_Lapwing @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder The irony is Lucy, that this should be a great project but somewhere along the line, people involved in delivering it have fallen at the 1st hurdle to get the basics right. I‚Äôve seen it too many times whilst working in Conservation, but when it‚Äôs on my patch it is a step too far!

Yes. Day out yesterday the fresh air & feeling of freedom from the physical mental chains of the landfill fumes. If I had the money I‚Äôd just buy a second home somewhere else. It‚Äôs tragic @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice #StopTheStink https://t.co/a3BiLcgW4Z

@copelandbc @MikeStarkie @unitedutilities @CumbriaHighways @HighwaysNWEST @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC Reported severe flooding & damage to property on many occasions. Requested contact but getting no response. Help desperately needed. How would you feel if this was your property? https://t.co/SqVZgMFspD

This week, we‚Äôve visited #WalleysQuarry to assess @RedIndustries2 progress on the required capping works. 

We expect Red Industries to complete that work today. 

See our webpage for further updates and air quality information. https://t.co/6B9i1x2fA0

#NewcastleUnderLyme https://t.co/GengkU8LDM

@TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @EmmaHowardBoyd please don‚Äôt allow the Lower Otter Project to become another example of awful habitat destruction - another laughing stock. Really, where is @NaturalEngland  &  @EnvAgency these days, and their leadership? Delay until after nesting! https://t.co/UIFWOQoE7N

tweets.text: @WiseBirding @PortandWey @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup 2/2 ... e.g. felling a single tree - proceed with caution after basic survey. Felling multiple trees < 10 sq m - qualified ecologist to carry out detailed survey before proceeding. Felling > 10 sq m - only if works essential and with on-site ecologist present during works.

@WiseBirding @PortandWey @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup The evidential requirement under the current law prevents it being taken seriously, and it needs to change. In my view a risk-based assessment should be made of any scrub clearance during nesting season and restrictions applied accordingly... 1/2

tweets.text: I don't usually do this sort of thing, but when it is on my local patch it really gets to me!! Scrub & tree removal in May is terrible practice. Please retweet. https://t.co/cYEIymHH0K Two videos showing the area & my concerns. @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup https://t.co/U8doUyBP5K

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgency I wonder if they'd have the goodwill at least to turn up to people's homes with a H2S monitor when they ring concerned for their health... You know to prove it wasn't that bad. Instead of just not believe people....
